intro: Stylidium drummondianum, commonly known as the Drummond's stickseed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. Stylidium drummondianum is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptation to drought conditions.
